result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott P. Dervin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, unless completed AODA and have written authority from Agent to possess/consume alcohol .
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Dave Barnick or go upon any of his properties, including Marion Hardware.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

ADA Fassbender present.
Def. present - in custody.
Atty. Melissa Dalkert present.
Plea questionnaire filed w/the Court.
Ct. #2 - NC plea
Ct. #1 - D&RI
Ct. #3 and Ct. #4 - D&RI
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #2.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
Restitution summary provided to court.
Statements by victim, Dave Barnick.
Imposed & stayed prison sentence - 3 1/2 years - 1 1/2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.
Conditions of extended supervision &  3 years probation:
1.  pay costs of the action + rest. surcharge of $314.76.
2.  pay restitution to Marion Hardware $3,147.75.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to participate in any counseling as directed by his Agent.
5.  def. not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages - unless completed AODA and have written authority to possess/consume alcohol.
6.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with Dave Barnick or go upon any of his properties, including Marion Hardware.
7.  def. to serve 9 months county jail w/work release privileges - court will not grant a furlough at this time, but if bonafide job interview is set up, def. may request a furlough at that time and the court would grant.
8.  def. to provide DNA sample, if not done.
WEDS form explained to def.

Appeal rights explained to def.
63 days credit (if revoked, 26 days credit and def is doing 9 months condition time, with 37 days already served).
